column1: Mercury_7011323,Which items would take the least amount of time to decompose in nature?,A): cut grass
column7: D): cut down trees,"(A) Cut grass: It's organic matter, and microorganisms like bacteria and fungi can break it down quickly.
column9: It might take a few weeks to a few months for it to decompose.
column11: (B) Paper cups: They're made of paper, which is a relatively simple organic material.
column13: Microorganisms can break it down, but it might take a bit longer than cut grass, around 1-3 months.
column15: (C) Newspapers: They're also made of paper, but they're more complex and might contain ink, dyes, and other chemicals that can slow down decomposition.
column17: It could take 6-12 months for them to decompose.
column19: (D) Cut down trees: Trees are complex organisms with a lot of cellulose, lignin, and other compounds that make them harder to break down.
column21: It could take years or even decades for them to decompose naturally.",0,0,1,-0.528,False,arc-challenge,LLaMA-3-8B

column1: AKDE&ED_2008_4_26,Which example shows a relationship between a living thing and a nonliving thing?,A): An insect is food for a salmon.
column3: B): Water carries a rock downstream.
column5: C): A tree removes a gas from the air.
column7: D): A flower makes food for a butterfly.,(A) An insect is food for a salmon.
column9: This is an example of a relationship between a living thing (insect) and a nonliving thing (salmon).
column13: This is an example of a relationship between two nonliving things (water and rock).
column15: (C) A tree removes a gas from the air.
column17: This is an example of a relationship between a living thing (tree) and a nonliving thing (air).
column19: (D) A flower makes food for a butterfly.
column21: This is an example of a relationship between two living things (flower and butterfly).,2,0,3,-0.273,False,arc-challenge,LLaMA-3-8B

column1: MCAS_2005_5_25,"When the temperature of a sample of 25 water is -5째C, the water is",A): a gas.
column7: D): a vapor.,"When the temperature of a sample of water is -5째C, the water is a solid.

column1: Mercury_7058415,"When cold air is at the tops of mountains, the air",A): will flow toward areas of lower pressure in valleys.
column3: B): will flow toward areas of higher pressure in valleys.
column5: C): is considered to be less dense than warmer air.
column7: D): is considered to be free of oxygen atoms.,"When cold air is at the tops of mountains, it is denser than the surrounding air.
column9: This is because cold air is more dense than warm air.
column11: As a result, the cold air will flow down the mountain, seeking the lower pressure in the valleys.
column13: This is known as the ""downslope flow"" or ""katabatic flow"".
column15: So, the correct answer is (A): will flow toward areas of lower pressure in valleys.<

column1: Mercury_402145,Which demonstrates a chemical change?,A): glass breaking
column7: D): water evaporating from a sidewalk,"(A) Glass breaking is a physical change, as the glass is still the same material, just in a different shape.
column9: (B) A garbage can rusting is a chemical change, as the iron in the can reacts with oxygen and moisture to form rust.
column11: (C) Sugar dissolving in water is a chemical change, as the sugar molecules break apart and mix with the water molecules.
column13: (D) Water evaporating from a sidewalk is a physical change, as the water molecules change from a liquid to a gas, but the molecules themselves don't change.",1,1,1,-0.403,False,arc-challenge,LLaMA-3-8B

column1: Mercury_7094290,"It was once thought that living organisms could come from non-living matter. For example, people believed that flies would develop from rotting meat. This idea was later disproved primarily because of",A): the discovery of the atom.
column7: D): the invention of the microscope.,"1.
column9: The idea that living organisms can come from non-living matter is called spontaneous generation.
column13: This idea was widely accepted until the 17th century.
column17: The discovery of microorganisms by Antonie van Leeuwenhoek in 1676 using the microscope was a major blow to spontaneous generation.
column21: The discovery of microorganisms showed that even in rotting meat, there were already living organisms present, which made it impossible for flies to develop from non-living matter.",2,3,7,-0.277,False,arc-challenge,LLaMA-3-8B

column1: Mercury_414352,A 0.20 kg softball travels 97 meters (m) south for 4.5 seconds (s). What piece of information distinguishes the velocity from the speed of the ball?,A): The ball went south.
column3: B): The ball flew for 4.5 s.
column7: D): The ball has a mass of 0.20 kg.,"1.
column9: The ball traveled 97 m, which is a distance.
column13: The ball took 4.5 s to travel that distance, which is a time.
column17: The ball's speed is the distance divided by the time: speed = distance / time = 97 m / 4.5 s = 21.4 m/s.
column21: The ball's velocity is the speed in a specific direction, which is south.
column23: The velocity is a vector, and it has both magnitude (speed) and direction.",0,0,1,-0.260,False,arc-challenge,LLaMA-3-8B
